case_vignette: A 13-year-old girl presents with a cystic lesion that has been on her forearm for several years. Concerned about the lesion, she reports that it may have grown slightly larger in the past year and it is intermittently painful. More recently, a second similar lesion has appeared in close proximity. She denies any other suspicious lesions elsewhere on her skin. Her family history is negative for skin cancer, and she reports no other medical conditions. Physical examination reveals two well-defined 6-mm nodules that are rubbery, slightly tender, and pink on the right proximal ventral forearm. The overlying skin is intact, and there is no associated adenopathy.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a bump on my forearm that's been there for a few years, and it's gotten a bit bigger and sometimes it hurts. A similar one has just popped up nearby.
Have you noticed any changes in the appearance of the bump or any discharge coming out of it?
No, the skin on top looks normal, and there's nothing coming out of it.
Have you had any other skin issues in the past?
No, I haven't had any other suspicious skin problems.
Have you had any family members with skin issues?
No, my family doesn't have a history of skin cancer.
Have you been exposed to any harmful UV radiation or chemicals?
I haven't mentioned anything about being exposed to harmful UV radiation or chemicals.
Have you noticed any changes in the size or shape of the bump over the past few months?
Yes, the bump may have grown slightly larger in the past year.
Have you noticed any changes in the color or texture of the skin around the bump?
No, the skin around the bump is intact and looks normal.
Have you noticed any changes in the skin on the rest of your body?
No, I haven't noticed any other suspicious lesions on my skin.
Have you noticed any changes in your overall health or any other symptoms?
No, I have not reported any other medical conditions or changes in my overall health.
Final Diagnosis: Seborrheic Keratosis.
